t: Proverbs 4
A Father’s Example
Listen,*pn sons, to a father’s discipline, and*ln pay attention so that you may gain understanding,
for*ln I am giving you good instruction. Don’t*ln abandon my teaching.
When*ln I was a son with my father, tender*ln and precious to my mother,
he*ln taught me and said, “Your*ln heart must hold on to my words. Keep*ln my commands and live.
Get*ln wisdom, get understanding; don’t*ln forget or turn away from the words from my mouth.
Don’t*ln abandon wisdom, and she will watch over you; love*ln her, and she will guard you.
Wisdom*ln is supreme — so get wisdom. And*ln whatever else you get, get understanding.
Cherish*ln her, and she will exalt you; if*ln you embrace her, she will honor you.
She*ln will place a garland of favor on your head; she*ln will give you a crown of beauty.”
Two Ways of Life
Listen,*pn my son. Accept my words, and*ln you will live many years.
I*ln am teaching you the way of wisdom; I*ln am guiding you on straight paths.
When*ln you walk, your steps will not be hindered; when*ln you run, you will not stumble.
Hold*ln on to instruction; don’t let go. Guard*ln it, for it is your life.
Keep*ln off the path of the wicked; don’t*ln proceed on the way of evil ones.
Avoid*ln it; don’t travel on it. Turn*ln away from it, and pass it by.
For*ln they can’t sleep unless*ln they have done what is evil; they*ln are robbed of sleep unless*ln they make someone stumble.
They*ln eat the bread of wickedness and*ln drink the wine of violence.
The*ln path of the righteous is like the light of dawn, shining*ln brighter and brighter until midday.
But*ln the way of the wicked is like the darkest gloom; they*ln don’t know what makes them stumble.
The Straight Path
My*pn son, pay attention to my words; listen*ln closely to my sayings.
Don’t*ln lose sight of them; keep*ln them within your heart.
For*ln they are life to those who find them, and*ln health to one’s whole body.
Guard*ln your heart above all else, for*ln it is the source of life.
Don’t*ln let your mouth speak dishonestly, and*ln don’t let your lips talk deviously.
Let*ln your eyes look forward; fix*ln your gaze straight ahead.
Carefully*ln consider the path for your feet, and*ln all your ways will be established.
Don’t*ln turn to the right or to the left; keep*ln your feet away from evil.
